Articles.Content:
STS-Ventura... A Stock... Well... Almost Stock(Asteroid Day) Shuttle.

Featuring thermal tiles, smooth lines, precise flight dynamics...

And with the advent of the new KS-25 engine, this shuttle is easy to fly. Maybe not so easy, because reentry doesn't have much margin for errors...

Download: http://kerbalx.com/crafts/7092

Javascript is disabled. View full album

that's a new use for the panels! Looks cool!

And is that a SILTS pod I see on top of the rudder!?

The panels and use of Ibeams is fantasic man.

Really creative, I haven't seen that done before. Good job, it's a lovely looking shuttle.
I have seen it before, but I marveled at how clean it is done. This is going to get my upvote on KerbalX. Even if I strongly dislike space shuttles.

I have seen it before, but I marveled at how clean it is done. This is going to get my upvote on KerbalX. Even if I strongly dislike space shuttles.

Who made smooth shuttle wing parts with Ibeams before?

thanks Guys :3

and yes... It's supposed to be a SILTS pod at the tail...

thanks Guys :3

and yes... It's supposed to be a SILTS pod at the tail...

AWESOME! First time I've seen it done on a shuttle here! Well done, and those wings are amazing!

Woah that's a really nice one. Well done!

How many parts does it have?

Woah that's a really nice one. Well done!

How many parts does it have?

516 parts in total... Orbiter itself have arround 388 parts. Can be a bit laggy on some systems. But it give the feels of flying a shuttle...
That's amazing! I love the heat tiles.

I think the devs likes your Shuttle luizo...

[twitter]666631909045235713[/twitter]
Hey man, did you try an SRB version?

[quote name='Majorjim']Hey man, did you try an SRB version?[/QUOTE]

I can try... But will change the range capabilities... :P

[quote name='MK3424']I think the devs likes your Shuttle luizo...
